       <div class="d-flex flex-items-baseline flex-justify-between mt-3"> 
        <h1 class="border-bottom-0">Repositories</h1> 
        <div class="d-none d-lg-block ml-2"> <button class="btn-link Link--secondary js-print tooltipped tooltipped-n" aria-label="Print this article"> <!-- From https://heroicons.dev/ --> 
          <svg fill="none" height="18" width="18" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" viewbox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor">
           <path d="M17 17h2a2 2 0 002-2v-4a2 2 0 00-2-2H5a2 2 0 00-2 2v4a2 2 0 002 2h2m2 4h6a2 2 0 002-2v-4a2 2 0 00-2-2H9a2 2 0 00-2 2v4a2 2 0 002 2zm8-12V5a2 2 0 00-2-2H9a2 2 0 00-2 2v4h10z"></path>
          </svg> </button> 
        </div>

      </div> 
      <div id="article-contents" class="article-grid-body"> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-organization-repositories" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-organization-repositories">List organization repositories</a> </h3> 
         <p>Lists repositories for the specified organization.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /orgs/{org}/repos</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-organization-repositories--parameters"> <a href="#list-organization-repositories--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#list-organization-repositories-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>org</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>type</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specifies the types of repositories you want returned. Can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>public</code>, <code>private</code>, <code>forks</code>, <code>sources</code>, <code>member</code>, <code>internal</code>. Note: For GitHub AE, can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>private</code>, <code>forks</code>, <code>sources</code>, <code>member</code>, <code>internal</code>. Default: <code>all</code>. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, <code>type</code> can also be <code>internal</code>. However, the <code>internal</code> value is not yet supported when a GitHub App calls this API with an installation access token.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>sort</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>created</code>, <code>updated</code>, <code>pushed</code>, <code>full_name</code>.</p> Default: <code>created</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>direction</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>asc</code> or <code>desc</code>. Default: when using <code>full_name</code>: <code>asc</code>, otherwise <code>desc</code></p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-organization-repositories--code-samples"> <a href="#list-organization-repositories--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/orgs/ORG/repos</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /orgs/{org}/repos'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">org</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'org'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">

         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="list-organization-repositories-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>You can set the visibility of a repository using the new <code>visibility</code> parameter in the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/">Repositories API</a>, and get a repository's visibility with a new response key. For more information, see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-12-03-internal-visibility-changes/">blog post</a>.</p> 
          <p>To access repository visibility during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.nebula-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>is_template</code> and <code>template_repository</code> keys are currently available for developer to preview. See <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-a-repository-using-a-template">Create a repository using a template</a> to learn how to create template repositories. To access these new response keys during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.baptiste-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-an-organization-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-an-organization-repository">Create an organization repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>Creates a new repository in the specified organization. The authenticated user must be a member of the organization.</p> 
         <p><strong>OAuth scope requirements</strong></p> 
         <p>When using <a href="https://docs.github.com/apps/building-oauth-apps/understanding-scopes-for-oauth-apps/">OAuth</a>, authorizations must include:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li><code>public_repo</code> scope or <code>repo</code> scope to create a public repository. Note: For GitHub AE, use <code>repo</code> scope to create an internal repository.</li> 
          <li><code>repo</code> scope to create a private repository</li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /orgs/{org}/repos</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-an-organization-repository--parameters"> <a href="#create-an-organization-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#create-an-organization-repository-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>org</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The name of the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A short description of the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>homepage</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A URL with more information about the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>private</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether the repository is private.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>visibility</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be <code>public</code> or <code>private</code>. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, <code>visibility</code> can also be <code>internal</code>. Note: For GitHub Enterprise Server and GitHub AE, this endpoint will only list repositories available to all users on the enterprise. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/about-repository-visibility#about-internal-repositories">Creating an internal repository</a>" in the GitHub Help documentation.<br> The <code>visibility</code> parameter overrides the <code>private</code> parameter when you use both parameters with the <code>nebula-preview</code> preview header.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_issues</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to enable issues for this repository or <code>false</code> to disable them.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_projects</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to enable projects for this repository or <code>false</code> to disable them. <strong>Note:</strong> If you're creating a repository in an organization that has disabled repository projects, the default is <code>false</code>, and if you pass <code>true</code>, the API returns an error.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_wiki</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to enable the wiki for this repository or <code>false</code> to disable it.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>is_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to make this repo available as a template repository or <code>false</code> to prevent it.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>team_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repository in an organization.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>auto_init</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Pass <code>true</code> to create an initial commit with empty README.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>gitignore_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Desired language or platform <a href="https://github.com/github/gitignore">.gitignore template</a> to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "Haskell".</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>license_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Choose an <a href="https://choosealicense.com/">open source license template</a> that best suits your needs, and then use the <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/licensing-a-repository/#searching-github-by-license-type">license keyword</a> as the <code>license_template</code> string. For example, "mit" or "mpl-2.0".</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_squash_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow squash-merging pull requests, or <code>false</code> to prevent squash-merging.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_merge_commit</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or <code>false</code> to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_rebase_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or <code>false</code> to prevent rebase-merging.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>delete_branch_on_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow automatically deleting head branches when pull requests are merged, or <code>false</code> to prevent automatic deletion.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-an-organization-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#create-an-organization-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/orgs/ORG/repos \
  -d '{"name":"name"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /orgs/{org}/repos'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">org</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'org'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'name'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1296269</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDEwOlJlcG9zaXRvcnkxMjk2MjY5"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Hello-World"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"full_name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat/Hello-World"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"owner"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,

         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="create-an-organization-repository-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>You can set the visibility of a repository using the new <code>visibility</code> parameter in the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/">Repositories API</a>, and get a repository's visibility with a new response key. For more information, see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-12-03-internal-visibility-changes/">blog post</a>.</p> 
          <p>To access repository visibility during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.nebula-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>is_template</code> and <code>template_repository</code> keys are currently available for developer to preview. See <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-a-repository-using-a-template">Create a repository using a template</a> to learn how to create template repositories. To access these new response keys during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.baptiste-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-repository">Get a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>When you pass the <code>scarlet-witch-preview</code> media type, requests to get a repository will also return the repository's code of conduct if it can be detected from the repository's code of conduct file.</p> 
         <p>The <code>parent</code> and <code>source</code> objects are present when the repository is a fork. <code>parent</code> is the repository this repository was forked from, <code>source</code> is the ultimate source for the network.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#get-a-repository-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Default response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre>

         <h4>Moved permanently</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 301 Moved Permanently</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-a-repository-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>You can set the visibility of a repository using the new <code>visibility</code> parameter in the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/">Repositories API</a>, and get a repository's visibility with a new response key. For more information, see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-12-03-internal-visibility-changes/">blog post</a>.</p> 
          <p>To access repository visibility during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.nebula-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The Codes of Conduct API is currently available for developers to preview.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.scarlet-witch-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-a-repository">Update a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: To edit a repository's topics, use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#replace-all-repository-topics">Replace all repository topics</a> endpoint.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#update-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#update-a-repository-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A short description of the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>homepage</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A URL with more information about the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>private</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to make the repository private or <code>false</code> to make it public. Default: <code>false</code>.<br> <strong>Note</strong>: You will get a <code>422</code> error if the organization restricts <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/repository-permission-levels-for-an-organization#changing-the-visibility-of-repositories">changing repository visibility</a> to organization owners and a non-owner tries to change the value of private. <strong>Note</strong>: You will get a <code>422</code> error if the organization restricts <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/repository-permission-levels-for-an-organization#changing-the-visibility-of-repositories">changing repository visibility</a> to organization owners and a non-owner tries to change the value of private.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>visibility</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be <code>public</code> or <code>private</code>. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, <code>visibility</code> can also be <code>internal</code>. The <code>visibility</code> parameter overrides the <code>private</code> parameter when you use both along with the <code>nebula-preview</code> preview header.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_issues</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to enable issues for this repository or <code>false</code> to disable them.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_projects</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to enable projects for this repository or <code>false</code> to disable them. <strong>Note:</strong> If you're creating a repository in an organization that has disabled repository projects, the default is <code>false</code>, and if you pass <code>true</code>, the API returns an error.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_wiki</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to enable the wiki for this repository or <code>false</code> to disable it.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>is_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to make this repo available as a template repository or <code>false</code> to prevent it.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>default_branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Updates the default branch for this repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_squash_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow squash-merging pull requests, or <code>false</code> to prevent squash-merging.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_merge_commit</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or <code>false</code> to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_rebase_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or <code>false</code> to prevent rebase-merging.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>delete_branch_on_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to allow automatically deleting head branches when pull requests are merged, or <code>false</code> to prevent automatic deletion.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>archived</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><code>true</code> to archive this repository. <strong>Note</strong>: You cannot unarchive repositories through the API.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#update-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world \
  -d '{"name":"name"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /repos/{owner}/{repo}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'name'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{

      <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/licenses/mit"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"spdx_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MIT"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDc6TGljZW5zZW1pdA=="</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/licenses/mit"</span>
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"forks"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"open_issues"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"watchers"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>
  }
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Temporary Redirect</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 307 Temporary Redirect</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>You can set the visibility of a repository using the new <code>visibility</code> parameter in the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/">Repositories API</a>, and get a repository's visibility with a new response key. For more information, see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-12-03-internal-visibility-changes/">blog post</a>.</p> 
          <p>To access repository visibility during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.nebula-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>is_template</code> and <code>template_repository</code> keys are currently available for developer to preview. See <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-a-repository-using-a-template">Create a repository using a template</a> to learn how to create template repositories. To access these new response keys during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.baptiste-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-a-repository">Delete a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>Deleting a repository requires admin access. If OAuth is used, the <code>delete_repo</code> scope is required.</p> 
         <p>If an organization owner has configured the organization to prevent members from deleting organization-owned repositories, you will get a <code>403 Forbidden</code> response.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#delete-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Temporary Redirect</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 307 Temporary Redirect</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>If an organization owner has configured the organization to prevent members from deleting organization-owned repositories, a member will get this response:</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"message"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Organization members cannot delete repositories."</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"documentation_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#delete-a-repository"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="enable-automated-security-fixes" class="pt-3"> <a href="#enable-automated-security-fixes">Enable automated security fixes</a> </h3> 
         <p>Enables automated security fixes for a repository. The authenticated user must have admin access to the repository. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes">Configuring automated security fixes</a>".</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/automated-security-fixes</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="enable-automated-security-fixes--parameters"> <a href="#enable-automated-security-fixes--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#enable-automated-security-fixes-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="enable-automated-security-fixes--code-samples"> <a href="#enable-automated-security-fixes--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.london-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/automated-security-fixes</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/automated-security-fixes'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'london'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="enable-automated-security-fixes-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Enabling or disabling automated security fixes is currently available for developers to preview. To access this new endpoint during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.london-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="disable-automated-security-fixes" class="pt-3"> <a href="#disable-automated-security-fixes">Disable automated security fixes</a> </h3> 
         <p>Disables automated security fixes for a repository. The authenticated user must have admin access to the repository. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes">Configuring automated security fixes</a>".</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/automated-security-fixes</code></pre> 
        <div>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repository-contributors" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repository-contributors">List repository contributors</a> </h3> 
         <p>Lists contributors to the specified repository and sorts them by the number of commits per contributor in descending order. This endpoint may return information that is a few hours old because the GitHub REST API v3 caches contributor data to improve performance.</p> 
         <p>GitHub identifies contributors by author email address. This endpoint groups contribution counts by GitHub user, which includes all associated email addresses. To improve performance, only the first 500 author email addresses in the repository link to GitHub users. The rest will appear as anonymous contributors without associated GitHub user information.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/contributors</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-contributors--parameters"> <a href="#list-repository-contributors--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>anon</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Set to <code>1</code> or <code>true</code> to include anonymous contributors in results.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-contributors--code-samples"> <a href="#list-repository-contributors--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/contributors</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/contributors'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>if repository contains content</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"followers_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"following_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"organizations_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"User"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"contributions"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">32</span>
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Response if repository is empty</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-repository-dispatch-event" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-repository-dispatch-event">Create a repository dispatch event</a> </h3> 
         <p>You can use this endpoint to trigger a webhook event called <code>repository_dispatch</code> when you want activity that happens outside of GitHub to trigger a GitHub Actions workflow or GitHub App webhook. You must configure your GitHub Actions workflow or GitHub App to run when the <code>repository_dispatch</code> event occurs. For an example <code>repository_dispatch</code> webhook payload, see "<a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads/#repository_dispatch">RepositoryDispatchEvent</a>."</p> 
         <p>The <code>client_payload</code> parameter is available for any extra information that your workflow might need. This parameter is a JSON payload that will be passed on when the webhook event is dispatched. For example, the <code>client_payload</code> can include a message that a user would like to send using a GitHub Actions workflow. Or the <code>client_payload</code> can be used as a test to debug your workflow.</p> 
         <p>This endpoint requires write access to the repository by providing either:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Personal access tokens with <code>repo</code> scope. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/articles/creating-a-personal-access-token-for-the-command-line">Creating a personal access token for the command line</a>" in the GitHub Help documentation.</li> 
          <li>GitHub Apps with both <code>metadata:read</code> and <code>contents:read&amp;write</code> permissions.</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p>This input example shows how you can use the <code>client_payload</code> as a test to debug your workflow.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/dispatches</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-dispatch-event--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-repository-dispatch-event--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>event_type</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. A custom webhook event name.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>client_payload</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>JSON payload with extra information about the webhook event that your action or worklow may use.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-dispatch-event--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-repository-dispatch-event--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/dispatches \
  -d '{"event_type":"event_type"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/dispatches'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">event_type</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'event_type'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repository-languages" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repository-languages">List repository languages</a> </h3> 
         <p>Lists languages for the specified repository. The value shown for each language is the number of bytes of code written in that language.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/languages</code></pre>

            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

}
</code></pre>

         <h3 id="get-all-repository-topics" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-all-repository-topics">Get all repository topics</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/topics</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-all-repository-topics--parameters"> <a href="#get-all-repository-topics--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#get-all-repository-topics-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-all-repository-topics--code-samples"> <a href="#get-all-repository-topics--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.mercy-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/topics</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/topics'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'mercy'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"names"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"atom"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"electron"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"api"</span>
  ]
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-all-repository-topics-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>topics</code> property for repositories on GitHub is currently available for developers to preview. To view the <code>topics</code> property in calls that return repository results, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.mercy-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="replace-all-repository-topics" class="pt-3"> <a href="#replace-all-repository-topics">Replace all repository topics</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/topics</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="replace-all-repository-topics--parameters"> <a href="#replace-all-repository-topics--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#replace-all-repository-topics-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>names</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. An array of topics to add to the repository. Pass one or more topics to <em>replace</em> the set of existing topics. Send an empty array (<code>[]</code>) to clear all topics from the repository. <strong>Note:</strong> Topic <code>names</code> cannot contain uppercase letters.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="replace-all-repository-topics--code-samples"> <a href="#replace-all-repository-topics--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.mercy-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/topics \
  -d '{"names":["names"]}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/topics'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">names</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">'names'</span>
  ],
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'mercy'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"names"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"atom"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"electron"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"api"</span>
  ]
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="replace-all-repository-topics-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>topics</code> property for repositories on GitHub is currently available for developers to preview. To view the <code>topics</code> property in calls that return repository results, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.mercy-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="transfer-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#transfer-a-repository">Transfer a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>A transfer request will need to be accepted by the new owner when transferring a personal repository to another user. The response will contain the original <code>owner</code>, and the transfer will continue asynchronously. For more details on the requirements to transfer personal and organization-owned repositories, see <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/about-repository-transfers/">about repository transfers</a>.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/transfer</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="transfer-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#transfer-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>new_owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The username or organization name the repository will be transferred to.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>team_ids</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of integers</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>ID of the team or teams to add to the repository. Teams can only be added to organization-owned repositories.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="transfer-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#transfer-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/transfer \
  -d '{"new_owner":"new_owner"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/transfer'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">new_owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'new_owner'</span>
})
</code></pre>
