       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository">Check if vulnerability alerts are enabled for a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>Shows whether dependency alerts are enabled or disabled for a repository. The authenticated user must have admin access to the repository. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies">About security alerts for vulnerable dependencies</a>".</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/vulnerability-alerts</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.dorian-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/vulnerability-alerts</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/vulnerability-alerts'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'dorian'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response if repository is enabled with vulnerability alerts</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Not Found if repository is not enabled with vulnerability alerts</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4 id="check-if-vulnerability-alerts-are-enabled-for-a-repository-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Enabling and disabling dependency alerts for a repository using the REST API is currently available for developers to preview. To access these new endpoints during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.dorian-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="enable-vulnerability-alerts" class="pt-3"> <a href="#enable-vulnerability-alerts">Enable vulnerability alerts</a> </h3> 
         <p>Enables dependency alerts and the dependency graph for a repository. The authenticated user must have admin access to the repository. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies">About security alerts for vulnerable dependencies</a>".</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/vulnerability-alerts</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="enable-vulnerability-alerts--parameters"> <a href="#enable-vulnerability-alerts--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#enable-vulnerability-alerts-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="enable-vulnerability-alerts--code-samples"> <a href="#enable-vulnerability-alerts--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.dorian-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/vulnerability-alerts</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/vulnerability-alerts'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'dorian'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="enable-vulnerability-alerts-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Enabling and disabling dependency alerts for a repository using the REST API is currently available for developers to preview. To access these new endpoints during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.dorian-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>.

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="disable-vulnerability-alerts" class="pt-3"> <a href="#disable-vulnerability-alerts">Disable vulnerability alerts</a> </h3> 
         <p>Disables dependency alerts and the dependency graph for a repository. The authenticated user must have admin access to the repository. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies">About security alerts for vulnerable dependencies</a>".</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/vulnerability-alerts</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="disable-vulnerability-alerts--parameters"> <a href="#disable-vulnerability-alerts--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#disable-vulnerability-alerts-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \

          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li>

         <h4 id="disable-vulnerability-alerts-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Enabling and disabling dependency alerts for a repository using the REST API is currently available for developers to preview. To access these new endpoints during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p>

       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-repository-using-a-template" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-repository-using-a-template">Create a repository using a template</a> </h3> 
         <p>Creates a new repository using a repository template. Use the <code>template_owner</code> and <code>template_repo</code> route parameters to specify the repository to use as the template. The authenticated user must own or be a member of an organization that owns the repository. To check if a repository is available to use as a template, get the repository's information using the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#get-a-repository">Get a repository</a> endpoint and check that the <code>is_template</code> key is <code>true</code>.</p> 
         <p><strong>OAuth scope requirements</strong></p> 
         <p>When using <a href="https://docs.github.com/apps/building-oauth-apps/understanding-scopes-for-oauth-apps/">OAuth</a>, authorizations must include:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li><code>public_repo</code> scope or <code>repo</code> scope to create a public repository. Note: For GitHub AE, use <code>repo</code> scope to create an internal repository.</li> 
          <li><code>repo</code> scope to create a private repository</li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{template_owner}/{template_repo}/generate</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-using-a-template--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-repository-using-a-template--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#create-a-repository-using-a-template-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>template_owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>template_repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The organization or person who will own the new repository. To create a new repository in an organization, the authenticated user must be a member of the specified organization.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The name of the new repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A short description of the new repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>include_all_branches</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Set to <code>true</code> to include the directory structure and files from all branches in the template repository, and not just the default branch. Default: <code>false</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>private</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Either <code>true</code> to create a new private repository or <code>false</code> to create a new public one.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-using-a-template--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-repository-using-a-template--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.baptiste-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/TEMPLATE_OWNER/TEMPLATE_REPO/generate \
  -d '{"name":"name"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{template_owner}/{template_repo}/generate'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">template_owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'template_owner'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">template_repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'template_repo'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'name'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'baptiste'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4>

         </div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-using-a-template-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Creating and using repository templates is currently available for developers to preview. To access this new endpoint during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.baptiste-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-public-repositories" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-public-repositories">List public repositories</a> </h3> 
         <p>Lists all public repositories in the order that they were created.</p> 
         <p>Note:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li>For GitHub Enterprise Server, this endpoint will only list repositories available to all users on the enterprise.</li> 
          <li>Pagination is powered exclusively by the <code>since</code> parameter. Use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header">Link header</a> to get the URL for the next page of repositories.</li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repositories</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-public-repositories--parameters"> <a href="#list-public-repositories--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>since</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A repository ID. Only return repositories with an ID greater than this ID.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-public-repositories--code-samples"> <a href="#list-public-repositories--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repositories</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repositories'</span>)
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre>

    <span class="hljs-attr">"teams_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/teams"</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"hooks_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"http://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks"</span>
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Not modified</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 304 Not Modified</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repositories-for-the-authenticated-user" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repositories-for-the-authenticated-user">List repositories for the authenticated user</a> </h3> 
         <p>Lists repositories that the authenticated user has explicit permission (<code>:read</code>, <code>:write</code>, or <code>:admin</code>) to access.</p> 
         <p>The authenticated user has explicit permission to access repositories they own, repositories where they are a collaborator, and repositories that they can access through an organization membership.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /user/repos</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-repositories-for-the-authenticated-user--parameters"> <a href="#list-repositories-for-the-authenticated-user--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>visibility</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>public</code>, or <code>private</code>. Note: For GitHub AE, can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>internal</code>, or <code>private</code>.</p> Default: <code>all</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>affiliation</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Comma-separated list of values. Can include:<br> * <code>owner</code>: Repositories that are owned by the authenticated user.<br> * <code>collaborator</code>: Repositories that the user has been added to as a collaborator.<br> * <code>organization_member</code>: Repositories that the user has access to through being a member of an organization. This includes every repository on every team that the user is on.</p> Default: <code>owner,collaborator,organization_member</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>type</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>owner</code>, <code>public</code>, <code>private</code>, <code>member</code>. Note: For GitHub AE, can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>owner</code>, <code>internal</code>, <code>private</code>, <code>member</code>. Default: <code>all</code> </p> <p>Will cause a <code>422</code> error if used in the same request as <strong>visibility</strong> or <strong>affiliation</strong>. Will cause a <code>422</code> error if used in the same request as <strong>visibility</strong> or <strong>affiliation</strong>.</p> Default: <code>all</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>sort</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>created</code>, <code>updated</code>, <code>pushed</code>, <code>full_name</code>.</p> Default: <code>full_name</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>direction</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>asc</code> or <code>desc</code>. Default: <code>asc</code> when using <code>full_name</code>, otherwise <code>desc</code></p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>since</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> format: <code>YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>before</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601">ISO 8601</a> format: <code>YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-repositories-for-the-authenticated-user--code-samples"> <a href="#list-repositories-for-the-authenticated-user--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/user/repos</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /user/repos'</span>)
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Default response</h4>

    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"forks"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"open_issues"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"watchers"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Not modified</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 304 Not Modified</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Requires authentication</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 401 Unauthorized</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user">Create a repository for the authenticated user</a> </h3> 
         <p>Creates a new repository for the authenticated user.</p> 
         <p><strong>OAuth scope requirements</strong></p> 
         <p>When using <a href="https://docs.github.com/apps/building-oauth-apps/understanding-scopes-for-oauth-apps/">OAuth</a>, authorizations must include:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li><code>public_repo</code> scope or <code>repo</code> scope to create a public repository. Note: For GitHub AE, use <code>repo</code> scope to create an internal repository.</li> 
          <li><code>repo</code> scope to create a private repository.</li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /user/repos</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The name of the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A short description of the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>homepage</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A URL with more information about the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>private</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether the repository is private.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_issues</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether issues are enabled.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_projects</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether projects are enabled.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_wiki</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether the wiki is enabled.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>team_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repository in an organization.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>auto_init</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether the repository is initialized with a minimal README.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>gitignore_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The desired language or platform to apply to the .gitignore.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>license_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The license keyword of the open source license for this repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_squash_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_merge_commit</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether to allow merge commits for pull requests.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_rebase_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether to allow rebase merges for pull requests.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>delete_branch_on_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether to delete head branches when pull requests are merged</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>has_downloads</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether downloads are enabled.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>is_template</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Whether this repository acts as a template that can be used to generate new repositories.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/user/repos \
  -d '{"name":"name"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /user/repos'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'name'</span>
})
</code></pre>

         <h4>Not modified</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 304 Not Modified</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Bad Request</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 400 Bad Request</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Requires authentication</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 401 Unauthorized</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-for-the-authenticated-user-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>You can set the visibility of a repository using the new <code>visibility</code> parameter in the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/">Repositories API</a>, and get a repository's visibility with a new response key. For more information, see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-12-03-internal-visibility-changes/">blog post</a>.</p> 
          <p>To access repository visibility during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.nebula-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>is_template</code> and <code>template_repository</code> keys are currently available for developer to preview. See <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-a-repository-using-a-template">Create a repository using a template</a> to learn how to create template repositories. To access these new response keys during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.baptiste-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repositories-for-a-user" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repositories-for-a-user">List repositories for a user</a> </h3> 
         <p>Lists public repositories for the specified user. Note: For GitHub AE, this endpoint will list internal repositories for the specified user.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /users/{username}/repos</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-repositories-for-a-user--parameters"> <a href="#list-repositories-for-a-user--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#list-repositories-for-a-user-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>username</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>type</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>all</code>, <code>owner</code>, <code>member</code>.</p> Default: <code>owner</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>sort</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>created</code>, <code>updated</code>, <code>pushed</code>, <code>full_name</code>.</p> Default: <code>full_name</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>direction</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Can be one of <code>asc</code> or <code>desc</code>. Default: <code>asc</code> when using <code>full_name</code>, otherwise <code>desc</code></p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-repositories-for-a-user--code-samples"> <a href="#list-repositories-for-a-user--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/users/USERNAME/repos</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /users/{username}/repos'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">username</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'username'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4>

         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="list-repositories-for-a-user-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>You can set the visibility of a repository using the new <code>visibility</code> parameter in the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/">Repositories API</a>, and get a repository's visibility with a new response key. For more information, see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-12-03-internal-visibility-changes/">blog post</a>.</p> 
          <p>To access repository visibility during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.nebula-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="branches"><a href="#branches">Branches</a></h2> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-branches" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-branches">List branches</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-branches--parameters"> <a href="#list-branches--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>protected</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Setting to <code>true</code> returns only protected branches. When set to <code>false</code>, only unprotected branches are returned. Omitting this parameter returns all branches.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-branches--code-samples"> <a href="#list-branches--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"master"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"commit"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"sha"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"c5b97d5ae6c19d5c5df71a34c7fbeeda2479ccbc"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/commits/c5b97d5ae6c19d5c5df71a34c7fbeeda2479ccbc"</span>
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"protected"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"protection"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"required_status_checks"</span>: {
        <span class="hljs-attr">"enforcement_level"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"non_admins"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"contexts"</span>: [
          <span class="hljs-string">"ci-test"</span>,
          <span class="hljs-string">"linter"</span>
        ]
      }
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"protection_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/master/protection"</span>
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-branch" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-branch">Get a branch</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-branch--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-branch--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-branch--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-branch--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Moved permanently</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 301 Moved Permanently</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-branch-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-branch-protection">Get branch protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-branch-protection--parameters"> <a href="#get-branch-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#get-branch-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-branch-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#get-branch-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre>

         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre>

        }
      ]
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"dismiss_stale_reviews"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,

  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"restrictions"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/restrictions"</span>,

      {
        <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,

         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-branch-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The Protected Branches API now has a setting for requiring a specified number of approving pull request reviews before merging. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-03-16-protected-branches-required-approving-reviews">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.luke-cage-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-branch-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-branch-protection">Update branch protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Protecting a branch requires admin or owner permissions to the repository.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: Passing new arrays of <code>users</code> and <code>teams</code> replaces their previous values.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: The list of users, apps, and teams in total is limited to 100 items.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-branch-protection--parameters"> <a href="#update-branch-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#update-branch-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>required_status_checks</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. Require status checks to pass before merging. Set to <code>null</code> to disable.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="required_status_checks-object">Properties of the <code>required_status_checks</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>strict</code> (boolean)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. Require branches to be up to date before merging.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>contexts</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. The list of status checks to require in order to merge into this branch</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>enforce_admins</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. Enforce all configured restrictions for administrators. Set to <code>true</code> to enforce required status checks for repository administrators. Set to <code>null</code> to disable.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>required_pull_request_reviews</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. Require at least one approving review on a pull request, before merging. Set to <code>null</code> to disable.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="required_pull_request_reviews-object">Properties of the <code>required_pull_request_reviews</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>dismissal_restrictions</code> (object)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>Specify which users and teams can dismiss pull request reviews. Pass an empty <code>dismissal_restrictions</code> object to disable. User and team <code>dismissal_restrictions</code> are only available for organization-owned repositories. Omit this parameter for personal repositories.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>dismiss_stale_reviews</code> (boolean)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>Set to <code>true</code> if you want to automatically dismiss approving reviews when someone pushes a new commit.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>require_code_owner_reviews</code> (boolean)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>Blocks merging pull requests until <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/about-code-owners/">code owners</a> review them.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>required_approving_review_count</code> (integer)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>Specify the number of reviewers required to approve pull requests. Use a number between 1 and 6.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="dismissal_restrictions-object">Properties of the <code>dismissal_restrictions</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>users</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The list of user <code>login</code>s with dismissal access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>teams</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The list of team <code>slug</code>s with dismissal access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>restrictions</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. Restrict who can push to the protected branch. User, app, and team <code>restrictions</code> are only available for organization-owned repositories. Set to <code>null</code> to disable.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="restrictions-object">Properties of the <code>restrictions</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>users</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. The list of user <code>login</code>s with push access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>teams</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. The list of team <code>slug</code>s with push access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>apps</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The list of app <code>slug</code>s with push access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>required_linear_history</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Enforces a linear commit Git history, which prevents anyone from pushing merge commits to a branch. Set to <code>true</code> to enforce a linear commit history. Set to <code>false</code> to disable a linear commit Git history. Your repository must allow squash merging or rebase merging before you can enable a linear commit history. Default: <code>false</code>. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/github/administering-a-repository/requiring-a-linear-commit-history">Requiring a linear commit history</a>" in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_force_pushes</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Permits force pushes to the protected branch by anyone with write access to the repository. Set to <code>true</code> to allow force pushes. Set to <code>false</code> or <code>null</code> to block force pushes. Default: <code>false</code>. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/enabling-force-pushes-to-a-protected-branch">Enabling force pushes to a protected branch</a>" in the GitHub Help documentation."</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>allow_deletions</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Allows deletion of the protected branch by anyone with write access to the repository. Set to <code>false</code> to prevent deletion of the protected branch. Default: <code>false</code>. For more information, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/enabling-force-pushes-to-a-protected-branch">Enabling force pushes to a protected branch</a>" in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-branch-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#update-branch-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection \
  -d '{"required_status_checks":{"strict":true,"contexts":["contexts"]},"enforce_admins":true,"required_pull_request_reviews":{"dismissal_restrictions":{"users":["users"],"teams":["teams"]},"dismiss_stale_reviews":true,"require_code_owner_reviews":true,"required_approving_review_count":42},"restrictions":{"users":["users"],"teams":["teams"],"apps":["apps"]}}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">required_status_checks</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">strict</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">contexts</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'contexts'</span>
    ]
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">enforce_admins</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">required_pull_request_reviews</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">dismissal_restrictions</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">users</span>: [
        <span class="hljs-string">'users'</span>
      ],
      <span class="hljs-attr">teams</span>: [
        <span class="hljs-string">'teams'</span>
      ]
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">dismiss_stale_reviews</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">require_code_owner_reviews</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">required_approving_review_count</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">restrictions</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">users</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'users'</span>
    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">teams</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'teams'</span>
    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">apps</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'apps'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="update-branch-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The Protected Branches API now has a setting for requiring a specified number of approving pull request reviews before merging. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-03-16-protected-branches-required-approving-reviews">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.luke-cage-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-branch-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-branch-protection">Delete branch protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-branch-protection--parameters"> <a href="#delete-branch-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-branch-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-branch-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-admin-branch-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-admin-branch-protection">Get admin branch protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/enforce_admins</code></pre>
