        <div> 
         <h3 id="set-admin-branch-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#set-admin-branch-protection">Set admin branch protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Adding admin enforcement requires admin or owner permissions to the repository and branch protection to be enabled.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/enforce_admins</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="set-admin-branch-protection--parameters"> <a href="#set-admin-branch-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td>

           </tr>

         <h3 id="delete-admin-branch-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-admin-branch-protection">Delete admin branch protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Removing admin enforcement requires admin or owner permissions to the repository and branch protection to be enabled.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/enforce_admins</code></pre> 
        <div>

           </tr>

            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td>

            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td>

         <h3 id="get-pull-request-review-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-pull-request-review-protection">Get pull request review protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_pull_request_reviews</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-pull-request-review-protection--parameters"> <a href="#get-pull-request-review-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#get-pull-request-review-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td>

         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_pull_request_reviews</code></pre>

  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>

</code></pre>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"required_approving_review_count"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">2</span>

         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-pull-request-review-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The Protected Branches API now has a setting for requiring a specified number of approving pull request reviews before merging. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-03-16-protected-branches-required-approving-reviews">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.luke-cage-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-pull-request-review-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-pull-request-review-protection">Update pull request review protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Updating pull request review enforcement requires admin or owner permissions to the repository and branch protection to be enabled.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: Passing new arrays of <code>users</code> and <code>teams</code> replaces their previous values.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_pull_request_reviews</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-pull-request-review-protection--parameters"> <a href="#update-pull-request-review-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#update-pull-request-review-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>dismissal_restrictions</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specify which users and teams can dismiss pull request reviews. Pass an empty <code>dismissal_restrictions</code> object to disable. User and team <code>dismissal_restrictions</code> are only available for organization-owned repositories. Omit this parameter for personal repositories.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="dismissal_restrictions-object">Properties of the <code>dismissal_restrictions</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>users</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The list of user <code>login</code>s with dismissal access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>teams</code> (array of strings)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The list of team <code>slug</code>s with dismissal access</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>dismiss_stale_reviews</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Set to <code>true</code> if you want to automatically dismiss approving reviews when someone pushes a new commit.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>require_code_owner_reviews</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Blocks merging pull requests until <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/about-code-owners/">code owners</a> have reviewed.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>required_approving_review_count</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specifies the number of reviewers required to approve pull requests. Use a number between 1 and 6.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-pull-request-review-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#update-pull-request-review-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_pull_request_reviews \
  -d '{"dismissal_restrictions":{"users":["users"],"teams":["teams"]}}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_pull_request_reviews'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">dismissal_restrictions</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">users</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'users'</span>
    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">teams</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'teams'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/required_pull_request_reviews"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"dismissal_restrictions"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/dismissal_restrictions"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"users_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/dismissal_restrictions/users"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"teams_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/dismissal_restrictions/teams"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"users"</span>: [
      {
        <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,

        <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,

        <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"organizations_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,

        <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>

    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">"teams"</span>: [
      {
        <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
        <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VGVhbTE="</span>,

        <span class="hljs-attr">"slug"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"justice-league"</span>,

         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="update-pull-request-review-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The Protected Branches API now has a setting for requiring a specified number of approving pull request reviews before merging. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-03-16-protected-branches-required-approving-reviews">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.luke-cage-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-pull-request-review-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-pull-request-review-protection">Delete pull request review protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_pull_request_reviews</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-pull-request-review-protection--parameters"> <a href="#delete-pull-request-review-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead>

            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead>

            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td>

           </tr> 
          </tbody>

         <h4 id="delete-pull-request-review-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-pull-request-review-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_pull_request_reviews</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_pull_request_reviews'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-commit-signature-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-commit-signature-protection">Get commit signature protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>When authenticated with admin or owner permissions to the repository, you can use this endpoint to check whether a branch requires signed commits. An enabled status of <code>true</code> indicates you must sign commits on this branch. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/articles/signing-commits-with-gpg">Signing commits with GPG</a> in GitHub Help.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: You must enable branch protection to require signed commits.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_signatures</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-commit-signature-protection--parameters"> <a href="#get-commit-signature-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#get-commit-signature-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-commit-signature-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#get-commit-signature-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.zzzax-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_signatures</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_signatures'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'zzzax'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/required_signatures"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"enabled"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-commit-signature-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Protected Branches API can now manage a setting for requiring signed commits. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-02-22-protected-branches-required-signatures">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.zzzax-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-commit-signature-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-commit-signature-protection">Create commit signature protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>When authenticated with admin or owner permissions to the repository, you can use this endpoint to require signed commits on a branch. You must enable branch protection to require signed commits.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_signatures</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-commit-signature-protection--parameters"> <a href="#create-commit-signature-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#create-commit-signature-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-commit-signature-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#create-commit-signature-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.zzzax-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_signatures</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_signatures'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'zzzax'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/required_signatures"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"enabled"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="create-commit-signature-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Protected Branches API can now manage a setting for requiring signed commits. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-02-22-protected-branches-required-signatures">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.zzzax-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-commit-signature-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-commit-signature-protection">Delete commit signature protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>When authenticated with admin or owner permissions to the repository, you can use this endpoint to disable required signed commits on a branch. You must enable branch protection to require signed commits.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_signatures</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-commit-signature-protection--parameters"> <a href="#delete-commit-signature-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#delete-commit-signature-protection-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-commit-signature-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-commit-signature-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.zzzax-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_signatures</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_signatures'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'zzzax'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="delete-commit-signature-protection-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Protected Branches API can now manage a setting for requiring signed commits. This feature is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-02-22-protected-branches-required-signatures">blog post</a> for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.zzzax-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div>

         <h3 id="get-status-checks-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-status-checks-protection">Get status checks protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_status_checks</code></pre>

  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"strict"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"contexts"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"continuous-integration/travis-ci"</span>
  ],

}

        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-status-check-protection" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-status-check-protection">Update status check protection</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Updating required status checks requires admin or owner permissions to the repository and branch protection to be enabled.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_status_checks</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-status-check-protection--parameters"> <a href="#update-status-check-protection--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>strict</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Require branches to be up to date before merging.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>contexts</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The list of status checks to require in order to merge into this branch</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-status-check-protection--code-samples"> <a href="#update-status-check-protection--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/required_status_checks \
  -d '{"strict":true}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_status_checks'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">strict</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/required_status_checks"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"strict"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"contexts"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"continuous-integration/travis-ci"</span>
  ],
  <span class="hljs-attr">"contexts_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/branches/master/protection/required_status_checks/contexts"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="add-status-check-contexts" class="pt-3"> <a href="#add-status-check-contexts">Add status check contexts</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/required_status_checks/contexts</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="add-status-check-contexts--parameters"> <a href="#add-status-check-contexts--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table>

           <tr>

            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td>

           <tr>

            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-access-restrictions" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-access-restrictions">Get access restrictions</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Lists who has access to this protected branch.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: Users, apps, and teams <code>restrictions</code> are only available for organization-owned repositories.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-access-restrictions--parameters"> <a href="#get-access-restrictions--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead>

            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-access-restrictions" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-access-restrictions">Delete access restrictions</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Disables the ability to restrict who can push to this branch.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-access-restrictions--parameters"> <a href="#delete-access-restrictions--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-access-restrictions--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-access-restrictions--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/restrictions</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-apps-with-access-to-the-protected-branch" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-apps-with-access-to-the-protected-branch">Get apps with access to the protected branch</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Lists the GitHub Apps that have push access to this branch. Only installed GitHub Apps with <code>write</code> access to the <code>contents</code> permission can be added as authorized actors on a protected branch.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-apps-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--parameters"> <a href="#get-apps-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-apps-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--code-samples"> <a href="#get-apps-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre>

  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>

         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div>

          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li>

        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="add-app-access-restrictions" class="pt-3"> <a href="#add-app-access-restrictions">Add app access restrictions</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Grants the specified apps push access for this branch. Only installed GitHub Apps with <code>write</code> access to the <code>contents</code> permission can be added as authorized actors on a protected branch.</p> 
         <table>
          <thead>
           <tr>
            <th>Type</th>
            <th>Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td><code>array</code></td>
            <td>The GitHub Apps that have push access to this branch. Use the app's <code>slug</code>. <strong>Note</strong>: The list of users, apps, and teams in total is limited to 100 items.</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="add-app-access-restrictions--parameters"> <a href="#add-app-access-restrictions--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>apps</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. apps parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="add-app-access-restrictions--code-samples"> <a href="#add-app-access-restrictions--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[

    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,

         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="set-app-access-restrictions" class="pt-3"> <a href="#set-app-access-restrictions">Set app access restrictions</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Replaces the list of apps that have push access to this branch. This removes all apps that previously had push access and grants push access to the new list of apps. Only installed GitHub Apps with <code>write</code> access to the <code>contents</code> permission can be added as authorized actors on a protected branch.</p> 
         <table>
          <thead>
           <tr>
            <th>Type</th>
            <th>Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td><code>array</code></td>
            <td>The GitHub Apps that have push access to this branch. Use the app's <code>slug</code>. <strong>Note</strong>: The list of users, apps, and teams in total is limited to 100 items.</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="set-app-access-restrictions--parameters"> <a href="#set-app-access-restrictions--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>apps</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. apps parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="set-app-access-restrictions--code-samples"> <a href="#set-app-access-restrictions--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"slug"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octoapp"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDExOkludGVncmF0aW9uMQ=="</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"owner"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"github"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,

         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre>

       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="remove-app-access-restrictions" class="pt-3"> <a href="#remove-app-access-restrictions">Remove app access restrictions</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Removes the ability of an app to push to this branch. Only installed GitHub Apps with <code>write</code> access to the <code>contents</code> permission can be added as authorized actors on a protected branch.</p> 
         <table>
          <thead>
           <tr>
            <th>Type</th>
            <th>Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td><code>array</code></td>
            <td>The GitHub Apps that have push access to this branch. Use the app's <code>slug</code>. <strong>Note</strong>: The list of users, apps, and teams in total is limited to 100 items.</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="remove-app-access-restrictions--parameters"> <a href="#remove-app-access-restrictions--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>apps</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. apps parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="remove-app-access-restrictions--code-samples"> <a href="#remove-app-access-restrictions--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/restrictions/apps</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/apps'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[

    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,

        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-teams-with-access-to-the-protected-branch" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-teams-with-access-to-the-protected-branch">Get teams with access to the protected branch</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Lists the teams who have push access to this branch. The list includes child teams.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/teams</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-teams-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--parameters"> <a href="#get-teams-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-teams-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--code-samples"> <a href="#get-teams-with-access-to-the-protected-branch--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4>

         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \

  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VGVhbTE="</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/orgs/github/teams/justice-league"</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"permission"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"admin"</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"repositories_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/teams/1/repos"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"parent"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="add-team-access-restrictions" class="pt-3"> <a href="#add-team-access-restrictions">Add team access restrictions</a> </h3> 
         <p>Protected branches are available in public repositories with GitHub Free and GitHub Free for organizations, and in public and private repositories with GitHub Pro, GitHub Team, GitHub Enterprise Cloud, and GitHub Enterprise Server. For more information, see <a href="https://help.github.com/github/getting-started-with-github/githubs-products">GitHub's products</a> in the GitHub Help documentation.</p> 
         <p>Grants the specified teams push access for this branch. You can also give push access to child teams.</p> 
         <table>
          <thead>
           <tr>
            <th>Type</th>
            <th>Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td><code>array</code></td>
            <td>The teams that can have push access. Use the team's <code>slug</code>. <strong>Note</strong>: The list of users, apps, and teams in total is limited to 100 items.</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/teams</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="add-team-access-restrictions--parameters"> <a href="#add-team-access-restrictions--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>branch</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the branch.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>teams</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. teams parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="add-team-access-restrictions--code-samples"> <a href="#add-team-access-restrictions--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/branches/BRANCH/protection/restrictions/teams</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/branches/{branch}/protection/restrictions/teams'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[

    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VGVhbTE="</span>,

         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre>

         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li>
