         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="list-deployments-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>inactive</code> state and the <code>log_url</code>, <code>environment_url</code>, and <code>auto_inactive</code> parameters are currently available for developers to preview. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-04-06-deployment-and-deployment-status-enhancements">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-deployment" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-deployment">Create a deployment</a> </h3> 
         <p>Deployments offer a few configurable parameters with certain defaults.</p> 
         <p>The <code>ref</code> parameter can be any named branch, tag, or SHA. At GitHub we often deploy branches and verify them before we merge a pull request.</p> 
         <p>The <code>environment</code> parameter allows deployments to be issued to different runtime environments. Teams often have multiple environments for verifying their applications, such as <code>production</code>, <code>staging</code>, and <code>qa</code>. This parameter makes it easier to track which environments have requested deployments. The default environment is <code>production</code>.</p> 
         <p>The <code>auto_merge</code> parameter is used to ensure that the requested ref is not behind the repository's default branch. If the ref <em>is</em> behind the default branch for the repository, we will attempt to merge it for you. If the merge succeeds, the API will return a successful merge commit. If merge conflicts prevent the merge from succeeding, the API will return a failure response.</p> 
         <p>By default, <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#statuses">commit statuses</a> for every submitted context must be in a <code>success</code> state. The <code>required_contexts</code> parameter allows you to specify a subset of contexts that must be <code>success</code>, or to specify contexts that have not yet been submitted. You are not required to use commit statuses to deploy. If you do not require any contexts or create any commit statuses, the deployment will always succeed.</p> 
         <p>The <code>payload</code> parameter is available for any extra information that a deployment system might need. It is a JSON text field that will be passed on when a deployment event is dispatched.</p> 
         <p>The <code>task</code> parameter is used by the deployment system to allow different execution paths. In the web world this might be <code>deploy:migrations</code> to run schema changes on the system. In the compiled world this could be a flag to compile an application with debugging enabled.</p> 
         <p>Users with <code>repo</code> or <code>repo_deployment</code> scopes can create a deployment for a given ref.</p> 
         <h4 id="merged-branch-response"><a href="#merged-branch-response">Merged branch response</a></h4> 
         <p>You will see this response when GitHub automatically merges the base branch into the topic branch instead of creating a deployment. This auto-merge happens when:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Auto-merge option is enabled in the repository</li> 
          <li>Topic branch does not include the latest changes on the base branch, which is <code>master</code> in the response example</li> 
          <li>There are no merge conflicts</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p>If there are no new commits in the base branch, a new request to create a deployment should give a successful response.</p> 
         <h4 id="merge-conflict-response"><a href="#merge-conflict-response">Merge conflict response</a></h4> 
         <p>This error happens when the <code>auto_merge</code> option is enabled and when the default branch (in this case <code>master</code>), can't be merged into the branch that's being deployed (in this case <code>topic-branch</code>), due to merge conflicts.</p> 
         <h4 id="failed-commit-status-checks"><a href="#failed-commit-status-checks">Failed commit status checks</a></h4> 
         <p>This error happens when the <code>required_contexts</code> parameter indicates that one or more contexts need to have a <code>success</code> status for the commit to be deployed, but one or more of the required contexts do not have a state of <code>success</code>.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-deployment--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-deployment--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#create-a-deployment-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>ref</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or SHA.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>task</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specifies a task to execute (e.g., <code>deploy</code> or <code>deploy:migrations</code>).</p> Default: <code>deploy</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>auto_merge</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Attempts to automatically merge the default branch into the requested ref, if it's behind the default branch.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>required_contexts</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#statuses">status</a> contexts to verify against commit status checks. If you omit this parameter, GitHub verifies all unique contexts before creating a deployment. To bypass checking entirely, pass an empty array. Defaults to all unique contexts.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>payload</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object or string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>JSON payload with extra information about the deployment.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>environment</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Name for the target deployment environment (e.g., <code>production</code>, <code>staging</code>, <code>qa</code>).</p> Default: <code>production</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Short description of the deployment.</p> Default: <code></code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>transient_environment</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specifies if the given environment is specific to the deployment and will no longer exist at some point in the future. Default: <code>false</code><br> <strong>Note:</strong> This parameter requires you to use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#enhanced-deployments"><code>application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>production_environment</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specifies if the given environment is one that end-users directly interact with. Default: <code>true</code> when <code>environment</code> is <code>production</code> and <code>false</code> otherwise.<br> <strong>Note:</strong> This parameter requires you to use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#enhanced-deployments"><code>application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-deployment--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-deployment--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/deployments \
  -d '{"ref":"ref"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">ref</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'ref'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Simple example</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/1"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDEwOkRlcGxveW1lbnQx"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"sha"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"a84d88e7554fc1fa21bcbc4efae3c782a70d2b9d"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"ref"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"topic-branch"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"task"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"deploy"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"payload"</span>: {},
  <span class="hljs-attr">"original_environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"staging"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"production"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Deploy request from hubot"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"followers_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"following_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"User"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"statuses_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/1/statuses"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"repository_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"transient_environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"production_environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Merged branch response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 202 Accepted</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"message"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Auto-merged master into topic-branch on deployment."</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Conflict when there is a merge conflict or the commit's status checks failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 409 Conflict</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="create-a-deployment-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>inactive</code> state and the <code>log_url</code>, <code>environment_url</code>, and <code>auto_inactive</code> parameters are currently available for developers to preview. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-04-06-deployment-and-deployment-status-enhancements">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-deployment" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-deployment">Get a deployment</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-deployment--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-deployment--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#get-a-deployment-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>deployment_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>deployment_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-deployment--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-deployment--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/deployments/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">deployment_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/1"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,

  <span class="hljs-attr">"environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"production"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Deploy request from hubot"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,

         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-a-deployment-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>inactive</code> state and the <code>log_url</code>, <code>environment_url</code>, and <code>auto_inactive</code> parameters are currently available for developers to preview. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-04-06-deployment-and-deployment-status-enhancements">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-a-deployment" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-a-deployment">Delete a deployment</a> </h3> 
         <p>To ensure there can always be an active deployment, you can only delete an <em>inactive</em> deployment. Anyone with <code>repo</code> or <code>repo_deployment</code> scopes can delete an inactive deployment.</p> 
         <p>To set a deployment as inactive, you must:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Create a new deployment that is active so that the system has a record of the current state, then delete the previously active deployment.</li> 
          <li>Mark the active deployment as inactive by adding any non-successful deployment status.</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p>For more information, see "<a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos/#create-a-deployment">Create a deployment</a>" and "<a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-a-deployment-status">Create a deployment status</a>."</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-deployment--parameters"> <a href="#delete-a-deployment--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>deployment_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>deployment_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-deployment--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-a-deployment--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/deployments/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">deployment_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-deployment-statuses" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-deployment-statuses">List deployment statuses</a> </h3> 
         <p>Users with pull access can view deployment statuses for a deployment:</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-deployment-statuses--parameters"> <a href="#list-deployment-statuses--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#list-deployment-statuses-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>deployment_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>deployment_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-deployment-statuses--code-samples"> <a href="#list-deployment-statuses--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/deployments/42/statuses</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">deployment_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/42/statuses/1"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDE2OkRlcGxveW1lbnRTdGF0dXMx"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"state"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"success"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"followers_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"following_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"organizations_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"User"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Deployment finished successfully."</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"production"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"target_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/deployment/42/output"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"deployment_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/42"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"repository_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"environment_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://test-branch.lab.acme.com"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"log_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/deployment/42/output"</span>
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="list-deployment-statuses-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>New features in the Deployments API on GitHub are currently available during a public beta. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-10-16-deployments-environments-states-and-auto-inactive-updates/">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the new <code>environment</code> parameter, the two new values for the <code>state</code> parameter (<code>in_progress</code> and <code>queued</code>), and use <code>auto_inactive</code> on production deployments during the public beta period, you must provide the following custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>inactive</code> state and the <code>log_url</code>, <code>environment_url</code>, and <code>auto_inactive</code> parameters are currently available for developers to preview. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-04-06-deployment-and-deployment-status-enhancements">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-deployment-status" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-deployment-status">Create a deployment status</a> </h3> 
         <p>Users with <code>push</code> access can create deployment statuses for a given deployment.</p> 
         <p>GitHub Apps require <code>read &amp; write</code> access to "Deployments" and <code>read-only</code> access to "Repo contents" (for private repos). OAuth Apps require the <code>repo_deployment</code> scope.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-deployment-status--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-deployment-status--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#create-a-deployment-status-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>deployment_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>deployment_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>state</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The state of the status. Can be one of <code>error</code>, <code>failure</code>, <code>inactive</code>, <code>in_progress</code>, <code>queued</code> <code>pending</code>, or <code>success</code>. <strong>Note:</strong> To use the <code>inactive</code> state, you must provide the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#enhanced-deployments"><code>application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></a> custom media type. To use the <code>in_progress</code> and <code>queued</code> states, you must provide the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#deployment-statuses"><code>application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json</code></a> custom media type. When you set a transient deployment to <code>inactive</code>, the deployment will be shown as <code>destroyed</code> in GitHub.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>target_url</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment. <strong>Note:</strong> It's recommended to use the <code>log_url</code> parameter, which replaces <code>target_url</code>.</p> Default: <code></code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>log_url</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The full URL of the deployment's output. This parameter replaces <code>target_url</code>. We will continue to accept <code>target_url</code> to support legacy uses, but we recommend replacing <code>target_url</code> with <code>log_url</code>. Setting <code>log_url</code> will automatically set <code>target_url</code> to the same value. Default: <code>""</code><br> <strong>Note:</strong> This parameter requires you to use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#enhanced-deployments"><code>application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.</p> Default: <code></code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A short description of the status. The maximum description length is 140 characters.</p> Default: <code></code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>environment</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Name for the target deployment environment, which can be changed when setting a deploy status. For example, <code>production</code>, <code>staging</code>, or <code>qa</code>. <strong>Note:</strong> This parameter requires you to use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#deployment-statuses"><code>application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>environment_url</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Sets the URL for accessing your environment. Default: <code>""</code><br> <strong>Note:</strong> This parameter requires you to use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#enhanced-deployments"><code>application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.</p> Default: <code></code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>auto_inactive</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Adds a new <code>inactive</code> status to all prior non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and <code>environment</code> name as the created status's deployment. An <code>inactive</code> status is only added to deployments that had a <code>success</code> state. Default: <code>true</code><br> <strong>Note:</strong> To add an <code>inactive</code> status to <code>production</code> environments, you must use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#deployment-statuses"><code>application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.<br> <strong>Note:</strong> This parameter requires you to use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/api-previews#enhanced-deployments"><code>application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></a> custom media type.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-deployment-status--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-deployment-status--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/deployments/42/statuses \
  -d '{"state":"state"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">deployment_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">state</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'state'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/42/statuses/1"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDE2OkRlcGxveW1lbnRTdGF0dXMx"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"state"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"success"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"followers_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"following_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"organizations_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"User"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Deployment finished successfully."</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"production"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"target_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/deployment/42/output"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"deployment_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/42"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"repository_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"environment_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://test-branch.lab.acme.com"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"log_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/deployment/42/output"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="create-a-deployment-status-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>New features in the Deployments API on GitHub are currently available during a public beta. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-10-16-deployments-environments-states-and-auto-inactive-updates/">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the new <code>environment</code> parameter, the two new values for the <code>state</code> parameter (<code>in_progress</code> and <code>queued</code>), and use <code>auto_inactive</code> on production deployments during the public beta period, you must provide the following custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>inactive</code> state and the <code>log_url</code>, <code>environment_url</code>, and <code>auto_inactive</code> parameters are currently available for developers to preview. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-04-06-deployment-and-deployment-status-enhancements">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-deployment-status" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-deployment-status">Get a deployment status</a> </h3> 
         <p>Users with pull access can view a deployment status for a deployment:</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses/{status_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-deployment-status--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-deployment-status--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. <a href="#get-a-deployment-status-preview-notices"> See preview notices </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>deployment_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>deployment_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>status_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-deployment-status--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-deployment-status--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/deployments/42/statuses/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses/{status_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">deployment_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">status_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/42/statuses/1"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDE2OkRlcGxveW1lbnRTdGF0dXMx"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"state"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"success"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"followers_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"following_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"organizations_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"User"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Deployment finished successfully."</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"environment"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"production"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"target_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/deployment/42/output"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"deployment_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/42"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"repository_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"environment_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://test-branch.lab.acme.com"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"log_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/deployment/42/output"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="get-a-deployment-status-preview-notices"> Preview notices </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>New features in the Deployments API on GitHub are currently available during a public beta. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2018-10-16-deployments-environments-states-and-auto-inactive-updates/">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the new <code>environment</code> parameter, the two new values for the <code>state</code> parameter (<code>in_progress</code> and <code>queued</code>), and use <code>auto_inactive</code> on production deployments during the public beta period, you must provide the following custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.flash-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>The <code>inactive</code> state and the <code>log_url</code>, <code>environment_url</code>, and <code>auto_inactive</code> parameters are currently available for developers to preview. Please see the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2016-04-06-deployment-and-deployment-status-enhancements">blog post</a> for full details.</p> 
          <p>To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.ant-man-preview+json</code></pre> 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="environments"><a href="#environments">Environments</a></h2> 
       <p>The Environments API allows you to create, configure, and delete environments. For more information about environments, see "<a href="/en/actions/reference/environments">Environments</a>." To manage environment secrets, see "<a href="/en/rest/reference/actions#secrets">Secrets</a>."</p> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-all-environments" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-all-environments">Get all environments</a> </h3> 
         <p>Get all environments for a repository.</p> 
         <p>Anyone with read access to the repository can use this endpoint. If the repository is private, you must use an access token with the <code>repo</code> scope. GitHub Apps must have the <code>actions:read</code> permission to use this endpoint.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-all-environments--parameters"> <a href="#get-all-environments--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-all-environments--code-samples"> <a href="#get-all-environments--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/environments</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-an-environment" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-an-environment">Get an environment</a> </h3> 
         <p>Anyone with read access to the repository can use this endpoint. If the repository is private, you must use an access token with the <code>repo</code> scope. GitHub Apps must have the <code>actions:read</code> permission to use this endpoint.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments/{environment_name}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-an-environment--parameters"> <a href="#get-an-environment--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>environment_name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the environment</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

        <hr>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-or-update-an-environment" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-or-update-an-environment">Create or update an environment</a> </h3> 
         <p>Create or update an environment with protection rules, such as required reviewers. For more information about environment protection rules, see "<a href="/en/actions/reference/environments#environment-protection-rules">Environments</a>."</p> 
         <p><strong>Note:</strong> Although you can use this operation to specify that only branches that match specified name patterns can deploy to this environment, you must use the UI to set the name patterns. For more information, see "<a href="/en/actions/reference/environments#deployment-branches">Environments</a>."</p> 
         <p><strong>Note:</strong> To create or update secrets for an environment, see "<a href="/en/rest/reference/actions#secrets">Secrets</a>."</p> 
         <p>You must authenticate using an access token with the repo scope to use this endpoint.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments/{environment_name}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-or-update-an-environment--parameters"> <a href="#create-or-update-an-environment--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>environment_name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the environment</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>wait_timer</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The amount of time to delay a job after the job is initially triggered. The time (in minutes) must be an integer between 0 and 43,200 (30 days).</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>reviewers</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of objects or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The people or teams that may review jobs that reference the environment. You can list up to six users or teams as reviewers. The reviewers must have at least read access to the repository. Only one of the required reviewers needs to approve the job for it to proceed.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="reviewers-items">Properties of the <code>reviewers</code> items</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>type</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The type of reviewer. Must be one of: <code>User</code> or <code>Team</code></p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>id</code> (integer)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The id of the user or team who can review the deployment</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>deployment_branch_policy</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The type of deployment branch policy for this environment. To allow all branches to deploy, set to <code>null</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="deployment_branch_policy-object">Properties of the <code>deployment_branch_policy</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>protected_branches</code> (boolean)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. Whether only branches with branch protection rules can deploy to this environment. If <code>protected_branches</code> is <code>true</code>, <code>custom_branch_policies</code> must be <code>false</code>; if <code>protected_branches</code> is <code>false</code>, <code>custom_branch_policies</code> must be <code>true</code>.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>custom_branch_policies</code> (boolean)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. Whether only branches that match the specified name patterns can deploy to this environment. If <code>custom_branch_policies</code> is <code>true</code>, <code>protected_branches</code> must be <code>false</code>; if <code>custom_branch_policies</code> is <code>false</code>, <code>protected_branches</code> must be <code>true</code>.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-or-update-an-environment--code-samples"> <a href="#create-or-update-an-environment--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/environments/ENVIRONMENT_NAME \
  -d '{"wait_timer":42}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments/{environment_name}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">environment_name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'environment_name'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">wait_timer</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">161088068</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDExOkVudmlyb25tZW50MTYxMDg4MDY4"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"staging"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/github/hello-world/environments/staging"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/github/hello-world/deployments/activity_log?environments_filter=staging"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2020-11-23T22:00:40Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2020-11-23T22:00:40Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"protection_rules"</span>: [
    {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">3736</span>,

            <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,

            <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
            <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,

            <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Justice League"</span>,
            <span class="hljs-attr">"slug"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"justice-league"</span>,
            <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"A great team."</span>,

          }
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">3756</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6R2F0ZTM3NTY="</span>,

    }

  <span class="hljs-attr">"deployment_branch_policy"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"protected_branches"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
