  }
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Validation error when the environment name is invalid or when `protected_branches` and `custom_branch_policies` in `deployment_branch_policy` are set to the same value</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-an-environment" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-an-environment">Delete an environment</a> </h3> 
         <p>You must authenticate using an access token with the repo scope to use this endpoint.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments/{environment_name}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-an-environment--parameters"> <a href="#delete-an-environment--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>environment_name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The name of the environment</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-an-environment--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-an-environment--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/environments/ENVIRONMENT_NAME</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/environments/{environment_name}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">environment_name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'environment_name'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Default response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="forks"><a href="#forks">Forks</a></h2> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-forks" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-forks">List forks</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/forks</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-forks--parameters"> <a href="#list-forks--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>sort</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The sort order. Can be either <code>newest</code>, <code>oldest</code>, or <code>stargazers</code>.</p> Default: <code>newest</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-forks--code-samples"> <a href="#list-forks--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/forks</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/forks'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre>

         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre>

</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Bad Request</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 400 Bad Request</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-fork" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-fork">Create a fork</a> </h3> 
         <p>Create a fork for the authenticated user.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: Forking a Repository happens asynchronously. You may have to wait a short period of time before you can access the git objects. If this takes longer than 5 minutes, be sure to contact <a href="https://support.github.com/contact">GitHub Support</a> or <a href="https://premium.githubsupport.com">GitHub Premium Support</a>.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/forks</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-fork--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-fork--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>organization</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Optional parameter to specify the organization name if forking into an organization.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-fork--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-fork--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/forks \
  -d '{"organization":"organization"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/forks'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">organization</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'organization'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4>

         <h4>Bad Request</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 400 Bad Request</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="invitations"><a href="#invitations">Invitations</a></h2> 
       <p>The Repository Invitations API allows users or external services to invite other users to collaborate on a repo. The invited users (or external services on behalf of invited users) can choose to accept or decline the invitations.</p> 
       <p>Note that the <code>repo:invite</code> <a href="/en/developers/apps/scopes-for-oauth-apps">OAuth scope</a> grants targeted access to invitations <strong>without</strong> also granting access to repository code, while the <code>repo</code> scope grants permission to code as well as invitations.</p> 
       <h3 id="invite-a-user-to-a-repository"><a href="#invite-a-user-to-a-repository">Invite a user to a repository</a></h3> 
       <p>Use the API endpoint for adding a collaborator. For more information, see "<a href="/en/rest/reference/repos#add-a-repository-collaborator">Add a repository collaborator</a>."</p> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repository-invitations" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repository-invitations">List repository invitations</a> </h3> 
         <p>When authenticating as a user with admin rights to a repository, this endpoint will list all currently open repository invitations.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/invitations</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-invitations--parameters"> <a href="#list-repository-invitations--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-invitations--code-samples"> <a href="#list-repository-invitations--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/invitations</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/invitations'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"repository"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1296269</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDEwOlJlcG9zaXRvcnkxMjk2MjY5"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Hello-World"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"full_name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat/Hello-World"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"owner"</span>: {
        <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,

         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-a-repository-invitation" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-a-repository-invitation">Update a repository invitation</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/invitations/{invitation_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository-invitation--parameters"> <a href="#update-a-repository-invitation--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>invitation_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>invitation_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>permissions</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The permissions that the associated user will have on the repository. Valid values are <code>read</code>, <code>write</code>, <code>maintain</code>, <code>triage</code>, and <code>admin</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository-invitation--code-samples"> <a href="#update-a-repository-invitation--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/invitations/42 \
  -d '{"permissions":"permissions"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /repos/{owner}/{repo}/invitations/{invitation_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">invitation_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">permissions</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'permissions'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{

  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/user/repository_invitations/1296269"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat/Hello-World/invitations"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-a-repository-invitation" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-a-repository-invitation">Delete a repository invitation</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/invitations/{invitation_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-repository-invitation--parameters"> <a href="#delete-a-repository-invitation--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>invitation_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>invitation_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-repository-invitation--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-a-repository-invitation--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/invitations/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/invitations/{invitation_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">invitation_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repository-invitations-for-the-authenticated-user" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repository-invitations-for-the-authenticated-user">List repository invitations for the authenticated user</a> </h3> 
         <p>When authenticating as a user, this endpoint will list all currently open repository invitations for that user.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /user/repository_invitations</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-invitations-for-the-authenticated-user--parameters"> <a href="#list-repository-invitations-for-the-authenticated-user--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-invitations-for-the-authenticated-user--code-samples"> <a href="#list-repository-invitations-for-the-authenticated-user--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/user/repository_invitations</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /user/repository_invitations'</span>)
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre>

          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[

    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Not modified</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 304 Not Modified</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Requires authentication</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 401 Unauthorized</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="accept-a-repository-invitation" class="pt-3"> <a href="#accept-a-repository-invitation">Accept a repository invitation</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /user/repository_invitations/{invitation_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="accept-a-repository-invitation--parameters"> <a href="#accept-a-repository-invitation--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>invitation_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>invitation_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="accept-a-repository-invitation--code-samples"> <a href="#accept-a-repository-invitation--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/user/repository_invitations/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /user/repository_invitations/{invitation_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">invitation_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Not modified</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 304 Not Modified</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Conflict</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 409 Conflict</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="decline-a-repository-invitation" class="pt-3"> <a href="#decline-a-repository-invitation">Decline a repository invitation</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /user/repository_invitations/{invitation_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="decline-a-repository-invitation--parameters"> <a href="#decline-a-repository-invitation--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>invitation_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>invitation_id parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="decline-a-repository-invitation--code-samples"> <a href="#decline-a-repository-invitation--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/user/repository_invitations/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /user/repository_invitations/{invitation_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">invitation_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Not modified</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 304 Not Modified</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Conflict</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 409 Conflict</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="merging"><a href="#merging">Merging</a></h2> 
       <p>The Repo Merging API supports merging branches in a repository. This accomplishes essentially the same thing as merging one branch into another in a local repository and then pushing to GitHub. The benefit is that the merge is done on the server side and a local repository is not needed. This makes it more appropriate for automation and other tools where maintaining local repositories would be cumbersome and inefficient.</p> 
       <p>The authenticated user will be the author of any merges done through this endpoint.</p> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="merge-a-branch" class="pt-3"> <a href="#merge-a-branch">Merge a branch</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/merges</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="merge-a-branch--parameters"> <a href="#merge-a-branch--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>base</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The name of the base branch that the head will be merged into.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>head</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The head to merge. This can be a branch name or a commit SHA1.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>commit_message</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="merge-a-branch--code-samples"> <a href="#merge-a-branch--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/merges \
  -d '{"base":"base","head":"head"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/merges'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">base</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'base'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">head</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'head'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Successful Response (The resulting merge commit)</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/commits/6dcb09b5b57875f334f61aebed695e2e4193db5e"</span>,

      <span class="hljs-attr">"raw_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat/Hello-World/raw/7ca483543807a51b6079e54ac4cc392bc29ae284/file1.txt"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"blob_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat/Hello-World/blob/7ca483543807a51b6079e54ac4cc392bc29ae284/file1.txt"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"patch"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@\n....."</span>
    }
  ]
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Response when already merged</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Not Found when the base or head does not exist</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Conflict when there is a merge conflict</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 409 Conflict</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="pages"><a href="#pages">Pages</a></h2> 
       <p>The GitHub Pages API retrieves information about your GitHub Pages configuration, and the statuses of your builds. Information about the site and the builds can only be accessed by authenticated owners, even if the websites are public. For more information, see "<a href="/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/about-github-pages">About GitHub Pages</a>."</p> 
       <p>In GitHub Pages API endpoints with a <code>status</code> key in their response, the value can be one of:</p> 
       <ul> 
        <li><code>null</code>: The site has yet to be built.</li> 
        <li><code>queued</code>: The build has been requested but not yet begun.</li> 
        <li><code>building</code>:The build is in progress.</li> 
        <li><code>built</code>: The site has been built.</li> 
        <li><code>errored</code>: Indicates an error occurred during the build.</li> 
       </ul> 
       <p>In GitHub Pages API endpoints that return GitHub Pages site information, the JSON responses include these fields:</p> 
       <ul> 
        <li><code>html_url</code>: The absolute URL (including scheme) of the rendered Pages site. For example, <code>https://username.github.io</code>.</li> 
        <li><code>source</code>: An object that contains the source branch and directory for the rendered Pages site. This includes:
         <ul> 
          <li><code>branch</code>: The repository branch used to publish your <a href="/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/configuring-a-publishing-source-for-your-github-pages-site">site's source files</a>. For example, <em>main</em> or <em>gh-pages</em>.</li> 
          <li><code>path</code>: The repository directory from which the site publishes. Will be either <code>/</code> or <code>/docs</code>.</li> 
         </ul></li> 
       </ul> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-github-pages-site" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-github-pages-site">Get a GitHub Pages site</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-github-pages-site--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-github-pages-site--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-github-pages-site--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-github-pages-site--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/pages</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/github/developer.github.com/pages"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"built"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"cname"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"developer.github.com"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"custom_404"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://developer.github.com"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"source"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"branch"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"master"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"path"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"/"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"public"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"https_certificate"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"state"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"approved"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Certificate is approved"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"domains"</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">"developer.github.com"</span>
    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">"expires_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2021-05-22"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"https_enforced"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-github-pages-site" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-github-pages-site">Create a GitHub Pages site</a> </h3> 
         <p>Configures a GitHub Pages site. For more information, see "<a href="/en/github/working-with-github-pages/about-github-pages">About GitHub Pages</a>."</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-github-pages-site--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-github-pages-site--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#create-a-github-pages-site-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>source</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The source branch and directory used to publish your Pages site.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="source-object">Properties of the <code>source</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>branch</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. The repository branch used to publish your site's source files.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>path</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The repository directory that includes the source files for the Pages site. Allowed paths are <code>/</code> or <code>/docs</code>. Default: <code>/</code></p></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-github-pages-site--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-github-pages-site--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.switcheroo-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/pages \
  -d '{"source":{"branch":"branch","path":"path"}}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">source</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">branch</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'branch'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">path</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'path'</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'switcheroo'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/github/developer.github.com/pages"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"built"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"cname"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"developer.github.com"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"custom_404"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://developer.github.com"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"source"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"branch"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"master"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"path"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"/"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"public"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"https_certificate"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"state"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"approved"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Certificate is approved"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"domains"</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">"developer.github.com"</span>
    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">"expires_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2021-05-22"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"https_enforced"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Conflict</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 409 Conflict</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="create-a-github-pages-site-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Enabling and disabling Pages in the Pages API is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-03-14-enabling-disabling-pages/">blog post</a> preview for more details. To access the new endpoints during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.switcheroo-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-information-about-a-github-pages-site" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-information-about-a-github-pages-site">Update information about a GitHub Pages site</a> </h3> 
         <p>Updates information for a GitHub Pages site. For more information, see "<a href="/en/github/working-with-github-pages/about-github-pages">About GitHub Pages</a>.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">put</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-information-about-a-github-pages-site--parameters"> <a href="#update-information-about-a-github-pages-site--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>cname</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string or nullable</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specify a custom domain for the repository. Sending a <code>null</code> value will remove the custom domain. For more about custom domains, see "<a href="https://help.github.com/articles/using-a-custom-domain-with-github-pages/">Using a custom domain with GitHub Pages</a>."</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>https_enforced</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Specify whether HTTPS should be enforced for the repository.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>public</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Configures access controls for the GitHub Pages site. If public is set to <code>true</code>, the site is accessible to anyone on the internet. If set to <code>false</code>, the site will only be accessible to users who have at least <code>read</code> access to the repository that published the site. This includes anyone in your Enterprise if the repository is set to <code>internal</code> visibility. This feature is only available to repositories in an organization on an Enterprise plan.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>source</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-information-about-a-github-pages-site--code-samples"> <a href="#update-information-about-a-github-pages-site--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PUT \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/pages \
  -d '{"cname":"cname"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PUT /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">cname</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'cname'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Bad Request</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 400 Bad Request</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div>

       </div>

         <h3 id="delete-a-github-pages-site" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-a-github-pages-site">Delete a GitHub Pages site</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-github-pages-site--parameters"> <a href="#delete-a-github-pages-site--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4>

          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> This API is under preview and subject to change. <a href="#delete-a-github-pages-site-preview-notices"> See preview notice </a> </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-github-pages-site--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-a-github-pages-site--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.switcheroo-preview+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/pages</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">mediaType</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">previews</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">'switcheroo'</span>
    ]
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Preview header missing</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 415 Unsupported Media Type</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-github-pages-site-preview-notices"> Preview notice </h4> 
         <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
          <p>Enabling and disabling Pages in the Pages API is currently available for developers to preview. See the <a href="https://developer.github.com/changes/2019-03-14-enabling-disabling-pages/">blog post</a> preview for more details. To access the new endpoints during the preview period, you must provide a custom <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/media-types">media type</a> in the <code>Accept</code> header:</p> 
          <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">application/vnd.github.switcheroo-preview+json</code></pre> ?? This header is <strong>required</strong>. 
         </div>

       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-github-pages-builds" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-github-pages-builds">List GitHub Pages builds</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages/builds</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-github-pages-builds--parameters"> <a href="#list-github-pages-builds--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="request-a-github-pages-build" class="pt-3"> <a href="#request-a-github-pages-build">Request a GitHub Pages build</a> </h3> 
         <p>You can request that your site be built from the latest revision on the default branch. This has the same effect as pushing a commit to your default branch, but does not require an additional commit. Manually triggering page builds can be helpful when diagnosing build warnings and failures.</p> 
         <p>Build requests are limited to one concurrent build per repository and one concurrent build per requester. If you request a build while another is still in progress, the second request will be queued until the first completes.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages/builds</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="request-a-github-pages-build--parameters"> <a href="#request-a-github-pages-build--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="request-a-github-pages-build--code-samples"> <a href="#request-a-github-pages-build--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/pages/builds</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages/builds'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/github/developer.github.com/pages/builds/latest"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"queued"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-dns-health-check-for-github-pages" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-dns-health-check-for-github-pages">Get a DNS health check for GitHub Pages</a> </h3> 
         <p>Gets a health check of the DNS settings for the <code>CNAME</code> record configured for a repository's GitHub Pages.</p> 
         <p>The first request to this endpoint returns a <code>202 Accepted</code> status and starts an asynchronous background task to get the results for the domain. After the background task completes, subsequent requests to this endpoint return a <code>200 OK</code> status with the health check results in the response.</p> 
         <p>Users must have admin or owner permissions. GitHub Apps must have the <code>pages:write</code> and <code>administration:write</code> permission to use this endpoint.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages/health</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-dns-health-check-for-github-pages--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-dns-health-check-for-github-pages--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-dns-health-check-for-github-pages--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-dns-health-check-for-github-pages--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/pages/health</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages/health'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4>

         <h4>Empty response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 202 Accepted</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Custom domains are not available for GitHub Pages</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 400 Bad Request</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>There isn't a CNAME for this page</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="releases"><a href="#releases">Releases</a></h2> 
       <div class="extended-markdown note border rounded-1 mb-4 p-3 color-border-info color-bg-info f5"> 
        <p><strong>Note:</strong> The Releases API replaces the Downloads API. You can retrieve the download count and browser download URL from the endpoints in this API that return releases and release assets.</p> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-releases" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-releases">List releases</a> </h3> 
         <p>This returns a list of releases, which does not include regular Git tags that have not been associated with a release. To get a list of Git tags, use the <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#list-repository-tags">Repository Tags API</a>.</p> 
         <p>Information about published releases are available to everyone. Only users with push access will receive listings for draft releases.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/releases</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-releases--parameters"> <a href="#list-releases--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-releases--code-samples"> <a href="#list-releases--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/releases</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/releases'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
