         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-the-hourly-commit-count-for-each-day" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-the-hourly-commit-count-for-each-day">Get the hourly commit count for each day</a> </h3> 
         <p>Each array contains the day number, hour number, and number of commits:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li><code>0-6</code>: Sunday - Saturday</li> 
          <li><code>0-23</code>: Hour of day</li> 
          <li>Number of commits</li> 
         </ul> 
         <p>For example, <code>[2, 14, 25]</code> indicates that there were 25 total commits, during the 2:00pm hour on Tuesdays. All times are based on the time zone of individual commits.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/stats/punch_card</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-the-hourly-commit-count-for-each-day--parameters"> <a href="#get-the-hourly-commit-count-for-each-day--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-the-hourly-commit-count-for-each-day--code-samples"> <a href="#get-the-hourly-commit-count-for-each-day--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/stats/punch_card</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/stats/punch_card'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>For example, `[2, 14, 25]` indicates that there were 25 total commits, during the 2:00pm hour on Tuesdays. All times are based on the time zone of individual commits.</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  [
    <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    <span class="hljs-number">5</span>
  ],
  [
    <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-number">43</span>
  ],
  [
    <span class="hljs-number">0</span>,
    <span class="hljs-number">2</span>,
    <span class="hljs-number">21</span>
  ]
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>A header with no content is returned.</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="statuses"><a href="#statuses">Statuses</a></h2> 
       <p>The status API allows external services to mark commits with an <code>error</code>, <code>failure</code>, <code>pending</code>, or <code>success</code> state, which is then reflected in pull requests involving those commits.</p> 
       <p>Statuses can also include an optional <code>description</code> and <code>target_url</code>, and we highly recommend providing them as they make statuses much more useful in the GitHub UI.</p> 
       <p>As an example, one common use is for continuous integration services to mark commits as passing or failing builds using status. The <code>target_url</code> would be the full URL to the build output, and the <code>description</code> would be the high level summary of what happened with the build.</p> 
       <p>Statuses can include a <code>context</code> to indicate what service is providing that status. For example, you may have your continuous integration service push statuses with a context of <code>ci</code>, and a security audit tool push statuses with a context of <code>security</code>. You can then use the <a href="/en/rest/reference/repos#get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference">Get the combined status for a specific reference</a> to retrieve the whole status for a commit.</p> 
       <p>Note that the <code>repo:status</code> <a href="/en/developers/apps/scopes-for-oauth-apps">OAuth scope</a> grants targeted access to statuses <strong>without</strong> also granting access to repository code, while the <code>repo</code> scope grants permission to code as well as statuses.</p> 
       <p>If you are developing a GitHub App and want to provide more detailed information about an external service, you may want to use the <a href="/en/rest/reference/checks">Checks API</a>.</p> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference">Get the combined status for a specific reference</a> </h3> 
         <p>Users with pull access in a repository can access a combined view of commit statuses for a given ref. The ref can be a SHA, a branch name, or a tag name.</p> 
         <p>The most recent status for each context is returned, up to 100. This field <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#pagination">paginates</a> if there are over 100 contexts.</p> 
         <p>Additionally, a combined <code>state</code> is returned. The <code>state</code> is one of:</p> 
         <ul> 
          <li><strong>failure</strong> if any of the contexts report as <code>error</code> or <code>failure</code></li> 
          <li><strong>pending</strong> if there are no statuses or a context is <code>pending</code></li> 
          <li><strong>success</strong> if the latest status for all contexts is <code>success</code></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/commits/{ref}/status</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference--parameters"> <a href="#get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>ref</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>ref parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference--code-samples"> <a href="#get-the-combined-status-for-a-specific-reference--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/commits/REF/status</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/commits/{ref}/status'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">ref</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'ref'</span>
})
</code></pre>

         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-commit-statuses-for-a-reference" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-commit-statuses-for-a-reference">List commit statuses for a reference</a> </h3> 
         <p>Users with pull access in a repository can view commit statuses for a given ref. The ref can be a SHA, a branch name, or a tag name. Statuses are returned in reverse chronological order. The first status in the list will be the latest one.</p> 
         <p>This resource is also available via a legacy route: <code>GET /repos/:owner/:repo/statuses/:ref</code>.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/commits/{ref}/statuses</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-commit-statuses-for-a-reference--parameters"> <a href="#list-commit-statuses-for-a-reference--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>ref</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>ref parameter</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-commit-statuses-for-a-reference--code-samples"> <a href="#list-commit-statuses-for-a-reference--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/commits/REF/statuses</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/commits/{ref}/statuses'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">ref</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'ref'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/statuses/6dcb09b5b57875f334f61aebed695e2e4193db5e"</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,

      <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,

</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Moved permanently</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 301 Moved Permanently</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-commit-status" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-commit-status">Create a commit status</a> </h3> 
         <p>Users with push access in a repository can create commit statuses for a given SHA.</p> 
         <p>Note: there is a limit of 1000 statuses per <code>sha</code> and <code>context</code> within a repository. Attempts to create more than 1000 statuses will result in a validation error.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/statuses/{sha}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-commit-status--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-commit-status--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>sha</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>state</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p><strong>Required</strong>. The state of the status. Can be one of <code>error</code>, <code>failure</code>, <code>pending</code>, or <code>success</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>target_url</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The target URL to associate with this status. This URL will be linked from the GitHub UI to allow users to easily see the source of the status.<br> For example, if your continuous integration system is posting build status, you would want to provide the deep link for the build output for this specific SHA:<br><code>http://ci.example.com/user/repo/build/sha</code></p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>description</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A short description of the status.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>context</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>A string label to differentiate this status from the status of other systems. This field is case-insensitive.</p> Default: <code>default</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-commit-status--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-commit-status--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/statuses/SHA \
  -d '{"state":"state"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/statuses/{sha}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">sha</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'sha'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">state</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'state'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/statuses/6dcb09b5b57875f334f61aebed695e2e4193db5e"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/hubot_happy.gif"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDY6U3RhdHVzMQ=="</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"state"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"success"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"description"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Build has completed successfully"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"target_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://ci.example.com/1000/output"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"context"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"continuous-integration/jenkins"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2012-07-20T01:19:13Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"login"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">1</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"node_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"MDQ6VXNlcjE="</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"avatar_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gravatar_id"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">""</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"html_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://github.com/octocat"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"followers_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"following_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"gists_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"starred_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"subscriptions_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"organizations_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"repos_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/events{/privacy}"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"received_events_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/users/octocat/received_events"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"User"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"site_admin"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">false</span>
  }
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="traffic"><a href="#traffic">Traffic</a></h2> 
       <p>For repositories that you have push access to, the traffic API provides access to the information provided in your repository graph. For more information, see "<a href="/en/github/visualizing-repository-data-with-graphs/viewing-traffic-to-a-repository" class="dotcom-only">Viewing traffic to a repository</a>."</p> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-repository-clones" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-repository-clones">Get repository clones</a> </h3> 
         <p>Get the total number of clones and breakdown per day or week for the last 14 days. Timestamps are aligned to UTC midnight of the beginning of the day or week. Week begins on Monday.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/traffic/clones</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-repository-clones--parameters"> <a href="#get-repository-clones--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Must be one of: <code>day</code>, <code>week</code>.</p> Default: <code>day</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-repository-clones--code-samples"> <a href="#get-repository-clones--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/traffic/clones</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/traffic/clones'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre>

         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-top-referral-paths" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-top-referral-paths">Get top referral paths</a> </h3> 
         <p>Get the top 10 popular contents over the last 14 days.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/traffic/popular/paths</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-top-referral-paths--parameters"> <a href="#get-top-referral-paths--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-top-referral-sources" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-top-referral-sources">Get top referral sources</a> </h3> 
         <p>Get the top 10 referrers over the last 14 days.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/traffic/popular/referrers</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-top-referral-sources--parameters"> <a href="#get-top-referral-sources--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-page-views" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-page-views">Get page views</a> </h3> 
         <p>Get the total number of views and breakdown per day or week for the last 14 days. Timestamps are aligned to UTC midnight of the beginning of the day or week. Week begins on Monday.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/traffic/views</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-page-views--parameters"> <a href="#get-page-views--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Must be one of: <code>day</code>, <code>week</code>.</p> Default: <code>day</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table>

        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="webhooks"><a href="#webhooks">Webhooks</a></h2> 
       <p>The Repository Webhooks API allows repository admins to manage the post-receive hooks for a repository. Webhooks can be managed using the JSON HTTP API, or the <a href="#PubSubHubbub">PubSubHubbub</a> API.</p> 
       <p>If you would like to set up a single webhook to receive events from all of your organization's repositories, see our API documentation for <a href="/en/rest/reference/orgs#webhooks">Organization Webhooks</a>.</p> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="list-repository-webhooks" class="pt-3"> <a href="#list-repository-webhooks">List repository webhooks</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-webhooks--parameters"> <a href="#list-repository-webhooks--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>per_page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Results per page (max 100).</p> Default: <code>30</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>page</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">query</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Page number of the results to fetch.</p> Default: <code>1</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="list-repository-webhooks--code-samples"> <a href="#list-repository-webhooks--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">[
  {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Repository"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">12345678</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"web"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"active"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"events"</span>: [
      <span class="hljs-string">"push"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-string">"pull_request"</span>
    ],
    <span class="hljs-attr">"config"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"content_type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"json"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"insecure_ssl"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"0"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/webhook"</span>
    },
    <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"test_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/test"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"ping_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/pings"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"last_response"</span>: {
      <span class="hljs-attr">"code"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"unused"</span>,
      <span class="hljs-attr">"message"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>
    }
  }
]
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="create-a-repository-webhook" class="pt-3"> <a href="#create-a-repository-webhook">Create a repository webhook</a> </h3> 
         <p>Repositories can have multiple webhooks installed. Each webhook should have a unique <code>config</code>. Multiple webhooks can share the same <code>config</code> as long as those webhooks do not have any <code>events</code> that overlap.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-webhook--parameters"> <a href="#create-a-repository-webhook--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>name</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Use <code>web</code> to create a webhook. Default: <code>web</code>. This parameter only accepts the value <code>web</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>config</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-hook-config-params">These are defined below</a>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="config-object">Properties of the <code>config</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>url</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>content_type</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include <code>json</code> and <code>form</code>. The default is <code>form</code>.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>secret</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>If provided, the <code>secret</code> will be used as the <code>key</code> to generate the HMAC hex digest value for <a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers">delivery signature headers</a>.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>insecure_ssl</code> (string or number)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for <code>url</code> will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include <code>0</code> (verification is performed) and <code>1</code> (verification is not performed). The default is <code>0</code>. <strong>We strongly recommend not setting this to <code>1</code> as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.</strong></p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>token</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>digest</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>events</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines what <a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads">events</a> the hook is triggered for.</p> Default: <code>push</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>active</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to <code>true</code> to send notifications.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="create-a-repository-webhook--code-samples"> <a href="#create-a-repository-webhook--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X POST \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks \
  -d '{"name":"name"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'name'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 201 Created</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Repository"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">12345678</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"web"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"active"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"events"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"push"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"pull_request"</span>
  ],
  <span class="hljs-attr">"config"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"content_type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"json"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"insecure_ssl"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"0"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/webhook"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"test_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/test"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"ping_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/pings"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"last_response"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"code"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"unused"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"message"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>
  }
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Forbidden</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 403 Forbidden</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-repository-webhook" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-repository-webhook">Get a repository webhook</a> </h3> 
         <p>Returns a webhook configured in a repository. To get only the webhook <code>config</code> properties, see "<a href="/en/rest/reference/repos#get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository">Get a webhook configuration for a repository</a>."</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-repository-webhook--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-repository-webhook--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>hook_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-repository-webhook--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-repository-webhook--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">hook_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Repository"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">12345678</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"web"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"active"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"events"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"push"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"pull_request"</span>
  ],
  <span class="hljs-attr">"config"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"content_type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"json"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"insecure_ssl"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"0"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/webhook"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"test_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/test"</span>,

    <span class="hljs-attr">"code"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"unused"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"message"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>
  }
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-a-repository-webhook" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-a-repository-webhook">Update a repository webhook</a> </h3> 
         <p>Updates a webhook configured in a repository. If you previously had a <code>secret</code> set, you must provide the same <code>secret</code> or set a new <code>secret</code> or the secret will be removed. If you are only updating individual webhook <code>config</code> properties, use "<a href="/en/rest/reference/repos#update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository">Update a webhook configuration for a repository</a>."</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository-webhook--parameters"> <a href="#update-a-repository-webhook--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>hook_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>config</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">object</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. <a href="https://docs.github.com/rest/reference/repos#create-hook-config-params">These are defined below</a>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr style="border: none;"> 
            <td colspan="4" class="has-nested-table"> 
             <details> <summary class="color-text-secondary"><h4 id="config-object">Properties of the <code>config</code> object</h4></summary> 
              <table> 
               <tbody> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>url</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p><strong>Required</strong>. The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>content_type</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include <code>json</code> and <code>form</code>. The default is <code>form</code>.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>secret</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>If provided, the <code>secret</code> will be used as the <code>key</code> to generate the HMAC hex digest value for <a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers">delivery signature headers</a>.</p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>insecure_ssl</code> (string or number)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><p>Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for <code>url</code> will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include <code>0</code> (verification is performed) and <code>1</code> (verification is not performed). The default is <code>0</code>. <strong>We strongly recommend not setting this to <code>1</code> as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.</strong></p></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>address</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"></td> 
                </tr> 
                <tr> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"><code>room</code> (string)</td> 
                 <td class="opacity-60"></td> 
                </tr> 
               </tbody> 
              </table> 
             </details> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>events</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines what <a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads">events</a> the hook is triggered for. This replaces the entire array of events.</p> Default: <code>push</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>add_events</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines a list of events to be added to the list of events that the Hook triggers for.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>remove_events</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">array of strings</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines a list of events to be removed from the list of events that the Hook triggers for.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>active</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">boolean</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to <code>true</code> to send notifications.</p> Default: <code>true</code> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-a-repository-webhook--code-samples"> <a href="#update-a-repository-webhook--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks/42 \
  -d '{"config":{"url":"url","content_type":"content_type","secret":"secret","insecure_ssl":"insecure_ssl","address":"address","room":"room"}}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">hook_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">config</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">url</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'url'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">content_type</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'content_type'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">secret</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'secret'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">insecure_ssl</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'insecure_ssl'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">address</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'address'</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">room</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'room'</span>
  }
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"Repository"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span>: <span class="hljs-number">12345678</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"web"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"active"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">true</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"events"</span>: [
    <span class="hljs-string">"push"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-string">"pull_request"</span>
  ],
  <span class="hljs-attr">"config"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"content_type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"json"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"insecure_ssl"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"0"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/webhook"</span>
  },
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updated_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"created_at"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"2019-06-03T00:57:16Z"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"test_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/test"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"ping_url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/hooks/12345678/pings"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"last_response"</span>: {
    <span class="hljs-attr">"code"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"status"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"unused"</span>,
    <span class="hljs-attr">"message"</span>: <span class="hljs-literal">null</span>
  }
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Validation failed</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 422 Unprocessable Entity</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="delete-a-repository-webhook" class="pt-3"> <a href="#delete-a-repository-webhook">Delete a repository webhook</a> </h3> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">delete</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-repository-webhook--parameters"> <a href="#delete-a-repository-webhook--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>hook_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="delete-a-repository-webhook--code-samples"> <a href="#delete-a-repository-webhook--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X DELETE \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks/42</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'DELETE /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">hook_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 204 No Content</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Resource not found</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 404 Not Found</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository">Get a webhook configuration for a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>Returns the webhook configuration for a repository. To get more information about the webhook, including the <code>active</code> state and <code>events</code>, use "<a href="/en/rest/reference/orgs#get-a-repository-webhook">Get a repository webhook</a>."</p> 
         <p>Access tokens must have the <code>read:repo_hook</code> or <code>repo</code> scope, and GitHub Apps must have the <code>repository_hooks:read</code> permission.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">get</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}/config</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>hook_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#get-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks/42/config</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}/config'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">hook_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"content_type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"json"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"insecure_ssl"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"0"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"secret"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"********"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/webhook"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository" class="pt-3"> <a href="#update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository">Update a webhook configuration for a repository</a> </h3> 
         <p>Updates the webhook configuration for a repository. To update more information about the webhook, including the <code>active</code> state and <code>events</code>, use "<a href="/en/rest/reference/orgs#update-a-repository-webhook">Update a repository webhook</a>."</p> 
         <p>Access tokens must have the <code>write:repo_hook</code> or <code>repo</code> scope, and GitHub Apps must have the <code>repository_hooks:write</code> permission.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">patch</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}/config</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--parameters"> <a href="#update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table> 
          <thead> 
           <tr> 
            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th> 
           </tr> 
          </thead> 
          <tbody> <!--
            Previews require an `accept` header. These used to be documented
            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          --> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">header</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p> Setting to <code>application/vnd.github.v3+json</code> is recommended. </p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>hook_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>url</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>content_type</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include <code>json</code> and <code>form</code>. The default is <code>form</code>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>secret</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>If provided, the <code>secret</code> will be used as the <code>key</code> to generate the HMAC hex digest value for <a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers">delivery signature headers</a>.</p> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>insecure_ssl</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string or number</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">body</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> <p>Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for <code>url</code> will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include <code>0</code> (verification is performed) and <code>1</code> (verification is not performed). The default is <code>0</code>. <strong>We strongly recommend not setting this to <code>1</code> as you are subject to man-in-the-middle and other attacks.</strong></p> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--code-samples"> <a href="#update-a-webhook-configuration-for-a-repository--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4> 
         <h5> Shell </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-shell">curl \
  -X PATCH \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/hello-world/hooks/42/config \
  -d '{"url":"url"}'</code></pre> 
         <h5> JavaScript (<a href="https://github.com/octokit/core.js#readme">@octokit/core.js</a>) </h5> 
         <pre><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span> octokit.request(<span class="hljs-string">'PATCH /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}/config'</span>, {
  <span class="hljs-attr">owner</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'octocat'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">repo</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'hello-world'</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">hook_id</span>: <span class="hljs-number">42</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">url</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'url'</span>
})
</code></pre> 
         <h4>Response</h4> 
         <pre><code>Status: 200 OK</code></pre> 
         <div class="height-constrained-code-block">
          <pre><code class="hljs language-json">{
  <span class="hljs-attr">"content_type"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"json"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"insecure_ssl"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"0"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"secret"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"********"</span>,
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span>: <span class="hljs-string">"https://example.com/webhook"</span>
}
</code></pre>
         </div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div>

        <div> 
         <h3 id="ping-a-repository-webhook" class="pt-3"> <a href="#ping-a-repository-webhook">Ping a repository webhook</a> </h3> 
         <p>This will trigger a <a href="https://docs.github.com/webhooks/#ping-event">ping event</a> to be sent to the hook.</p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}/pings</code></pre>

         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div>

         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div>

       <div> 
        <div> 
         <h3 id="test-the-push-repository-webhook" class="pt-3"> <a href="#test-the-push-repository-webhook">Test the push repository webhook</a> </h3> 
         <p>This will trigger the hook with the latest push to the current repository if the hook is subscribed to <code>push</code> events. If the hook is not subscribed to <code>push</code> events, the server will respond with 204 but no test POST will be generated.</p> 
         <p><strong>Note</strong>: Previously <code>/repos/:owner/:repo/hooks/:hook_id/test</code></p> 
        </div> 
        <pre><code><span class="color-bg-info-inverse color-text-inverse rounded-1 px-2 py-1" style="text-transform: uppercase">post</span> /repos/{owner}/{repo}/hooks/{hook_id}/tests</code></pre> 
        <div> 
         <h4 id="test-the-push-repository-webhook--parameters"> <a href="#test-the-push-repository-webhook--parameters">Parameters</a> </h4> 
         <table>

            <th>Name</th> 
            <th>Type</th> 
            <th>In</th> 
            <th>Description</th>

            as `operation.parameters` but have moved to `operation.x-github.previews`
          -->

            <td><code>accept</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td>

           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>owner</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>repo</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">string</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
           <tr> 
            <td><code>hook_id</code></td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">integer</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70">path</td> 
            <td class="opacity-70"> </td> 
           </tr> 
          </tbody> 
         </table> 
         <h4 id="test-the-push-repository-webhook--code-samples"> <a href="#test-the-push-repository-webhook--code-samples">Code samples</a> </h4>

         <div class="height-constrained-code-block"></div> 
         <h4>Notes</h4> 
         <ul class="mt-2"> 
          <li><a href="/en/developers/apps">Works with GitHub Apps</a></li> 
         </ul> 
        </div> 
        <hr> 
       </div> 
       <h3 id="receiving-webhooks"><a href="#receiving-webhooks">Receiving Webhooks</a></h3> 
       <p>In order for GitHub to send webhook payloads, your server needs to be accessible from the Internet. We also highly suggest using SSL so that we can send encrypted payloads over HTTPS.</p> 
       <h4 id="webhook-headers"><a href="#webhook-headers">Webhook headers</a></h4> 
       <p>GitHub will send along several HTTP headers to differentiate between event types and payload identifiers. See <a href="/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#delivery-headers">webhook headers</a> for details.</p> 
       <h3 id="pubsubhubbub"><a href="#pubsubhubbub">PubSubHubbub</a></h3> 
       <p>GitHub can also serve as a <a href="https://github.com/pubsubhubbub/PubSubHubbub">PubSubHubbub</a> hub for all repositories. PSHB is a simple publish/subscribe protocol that lets servers register to receive updates when a topic is updated. The updates are sent with an HTTP POST request to a callback URL. Topic URLs for a GitHub repository's pushes are in this format:</p> 
       <p><code>https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}/events/{event}</code></p> 
       <p>The event can be any available webhook event. For more information, see "<a href="/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads">Webhook events and payloads</a>."</p> 
       <h4 id="response-format"><a href="#response-format">Response format</a></h4> 
       <p>The default format is what <a href="/en/post-receive-hooks">existing post-receive hooks should expect</a>: A JSON body sent as the <code>payload</code> parameter in a POST. You can also specify to receive the raw JSON body with either an <code>Accept</code> header, or a <code>.json</code> extension.</p> 
       <pre><code>Accept: application/json
https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}/events/push.json
</code></pre> 
       <h4 id="callback-urls"><a href="#callback-urls">Callback URLs</a></h4> 
       <p>Callback URLs can use the <code>http://</code> protocol. </p> 
       <pre><code># Send updates to postbin.org
http://postbin.org/123
</code></pre> 
       <h4 id="subscr
